channel.title: kanthi
channel.description: Personal website and digital garden of Akshay Kanthi

item.title: When the Extension Won't Talk to the Backend
item.description: A late-night debugging session with entt-agent. Tailscale wouldn't connect, the React app showed no data, and I learned how my Chrome extension actually works.

item.title: What If Every Website Looked How I Wanted?
item.description: Started skin-deep - a Chrome extension that uses AI to transform website layouts. Realized CSS injection isn't enough; you need DOM transformation.

item.title: Visualizing the Knowledge Graph
item.description: Built a React frontend with ReactFlow to visualize the knowledge graph. Also debated whether a 'visit' should be an entity or a relationship.

item.title: Local LLMs, METAL Crashes, and the Cloud Fallback
item.description: Tried running LLMs locally with MLX on Apple Silicon. Learned that local inference is promising but fragile. Ended up using OpenRouter as a fallback.

item.title: Building a Second Brain from Browsing History
item.description: Started entt-agent - a Chrome extension that tracks browsing history and extracts entities to build a personal knowledge graph. Think personal Wikipedia, built automatically.

item.title: The Gap Between 'AI Can Click' and 'AI Can Test'
item.description: Researched AI-powered browser automation. Turns out teaching an AI to click buttons is easy. Teaching it to test your authenticated app is hard.

item.title: Claude History Analytics
item.description: Built scripts to analyze Claude Code conversation history and track daily prompt activity patterns.

item.title: Selfhosting: Caprover versus Cloudron
item.description: Caveat: I've been using Caprover for close to two years now and haven't had any trouble. I haven't used cloudron but have been considering it as a Caprover alternative. My top two reasons to look for alternatives. - Automatic backups for all apps. If my...

item.title: Baserow self hosting
item.description: Configuring SMTP on Baserow self hosted instance. I'm currently running a self-hosted instance of baserow which is being shared by my friend and I. Today he needed to reset his password. After a few hours of trying to configure the SMTP credentials it turns out...

item.title: Linked data
item.description: Centralised platforms to build knowledge graphs can solve for discoverability of data

item.title: Tech by the lake
item.description: It's such a relief to start writing a blog post when the person nudging you towards writing it has asked you not to spend more than an hour and has assured that no-one is going to read it. Thanks Lobo for that assurance. Phew! ðŸ¤§...

item.title: Making Computers Personal Again
item.description: The computer stopped being personal. Most of the apps I use on my computer today is on the browser. The data I create and view just rests somewhere else. It's anything but personal. Even development is moving to the cloud with @replit and @glitch What's...

item.title: Data Commons
item.description: You look up a place or a commute on Google Maps. After a couple hours Google casually informs you that the place has an average review of 4 and that if you agree with that rating. It's right there in the notification. You don't even...

item.title: Getting started with Customer Support on Telegram
item.description: Getting started with customer support on Telegram.

item.title: Telebooth
item.description: Telebooth: The easy interface for your Telegram Bot Conversations.

item.title: SASSY
item.description: A poem explaining software as a service.

item.title: FreeCodeCamp Offline
item.description: Freecodecamp running offline. An offline space space to learning programming and work on FreeCodeCamp exercises.

item.title: ReStart
item.description: Yet another blogging system. Yet another website.
